column4: znudnee are you trying to run the installer from within Windows or are you booting from the disc?
did you verify the md5 of the disc?
in this case yes
Who is the manufacturer? I would love to go and see that warranty
lenovo
they say warranty may be void if OS changes
officedepot
i know!
thats what they said
I would not do business with a manufacturer that would void warranties for someone trying to get out of a closed source operating system
because OS is not the one came with the pc
i know, but buyimng this pc was not my choice
well a extended 3 year warranty was bought with this pc with that vendor
only applies in officedepot
am wondering if MicroShaft is subsidizing the cost of the warranty,....sounds super shady
well was not cheap the warranty, but they say the hardware is under warranty for 3 years no matter what happens to the pc.
but original OS may stay the same, i think because of many pirate copys of windows around.
exactly ActionParsnip
Yeah I wouldnt put it past a company to do that,...first time I have heard of it,...but wouldnt say it never happens
also this is funny windows 7 will detect wired lan, but ubuntu wont
that one is easy,...the manufacturer made well sure that all of the components had MS signed drivers available before shipping
now i only can use wireless connection in ubntu
